         |- Lobosa                                              --
         |    |- Discosea                                       naked amoebae with a flattened, discoid body shape
         |    |    |- Acanthamoeba                              commonly recovered from soil, fresh water, other habitats. among the most prevalent protozoa found in the environment
         |    |    |- Balamuthia                                --
         |    |    |    |- balamuthia mandrillaris              --
         |    |    |- Himatismenida                             --
         |    |    |    |-  Cochliopodium gallicum,             --

         |    |    |[ Flabellinia ]                             --
         |    |    |- Vannella                                  --
         |    |    |- Paramoeba                                 parasitic of fish, crabs, sea urchins
1002 mya |    |[ Tubulinea ]                                    --
         |    |- Leptomyxida                                    --
         |    |    |- Leptomyxa                                 free-living lobose naked multinucleate amoebae in freshwater, soil and mosses
         |    |    |- Rhizamoeba                                free-living marine naked lobose amoebae
1002 mya |    |[ Eulobosia ]                                    --
         |    |- Euamoebida                                     --
         |    |    |- Hartmannellidae                           "limax amoeba"
  67 mya |    |    |[ Amoebidae ]                               --
         |    |    |- Amoeba                                    has a single nucleus
         |    |    |    |- amoeba proteus                       "first amoeba"
         |    |    |- Chaos                                     can have as many as a thousand nuclei
         |    |    |    |- chaos carolinensis                   "giant amoeba"
         |    |[ Arcellinida ]                                  lobose testate amoebae commonly found in soils, leaf litter, peat bogs and near/in fresh water
         |    |- Hyalospheniidae                                considered important bioindicators
         |    |- Difflugia                                      largest genus of Arcellinida
         |    |- Arcella                                        usually found in freshwaters and mosses, and rarely in soils
         |[ Conosa ]                                            --
         |- Archamoebae                                         --

         |    |[ Pelobionta ]                                   --
         |    |- Pelomyxa                                       anaerobic or microaerobic bottom sediments of stagnant freshwater ponds or slow-moving streams
         |    |    |- Pelomyxa palustris                        --
         |    |[ Mastigamoebida ]                               --
         |    |- Endolimax                                      --

         |    |    |- Allomyces                                 --

 337 mya |- Collembola                                    3,600 springtails
 290 mya |- Diplura                                             two-pronged bristletails

         |[ Chondrichthyes ]                                    cartilaginous fish
         |- Holocephali                                         chimaeras
         |[ Elasmobranchii ]                                    --
         |- Batoidea                                            rays
         |    |- Torpediniformes                                electric rays
         |    |- Rhinopristiformes                              shovelnose ray, guitar fish, etc
         |    |- Rajiformes                                     skates and relatives
         |    |- Myliobatiformes                                stingrays and relatives

  13 mya |- * Ochotonidae                                    37 pika family

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Opimoda / Deuterostomia / Sarcopterygii / Synapsida / Laurasiatheria / Ferae / Feliformia / Felidae
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
digitigrade, obligate carnivore, hypercarnivore
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
http://www.snowleopardconservancy.org/pdf/SL_Survey_Cons_Handbook_Part_3.pdf
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

         |    |- † Decennatherium                             † decennatherium
         |    |- † Sivatherium                                † sivatherium
         |[ Okapia ]                                          1 --
         |- • Okapia johnstoni                                • okapi / zebra-giraffe / forest giraffe

  3 mya  |- Anoplocapros                                 3 --

         |    |- • Anoplocapros inermis                  • eastern smooth boxfish
